attributes.action: Stop Margaret Thatcher's image being featured on the new £50 note
attributes.additional_details: Margaret Thatcher has always been seen by the masses as a person that single handedly shut down British industry and caused more poverty and hardship in the general population. Her actions in office put her more in line with the likes of a mediaeval monarch then a person representing the general populations will and well-being.
attributes.background: The new £50 note should feature a popular and significant person and not such a divisive figure as Margaret Thatcher who is fundamentally disliked by so many people. To place her image on the new £50 note would be a flagrant disregard for the strong feelings of the Citizens of Great Britain.

rejection.details:
Bank notes are the responsibility of the Bank of England, which is independent of the Government and Parliament.

You can find out how the Bank decides who will be on bank notes here: 
http://www.bankofengland.co.uk/banknotes/Pages/characters/selection.aspx
